questions.question: What is 'pip' in the Python ecosystem?
questions.explanation: pip is used to install and manage additional libraries that are not part of the Python standard library.

questions.question: Why should you use a Virtual Environment (venv)?

options.text: To keep different project dependencies separate
To avoid polluting your global Python installation

questions.explanation: Isolation ensures that a change in one project doesn't break another project on the same computer.

questions.question: Which command creates a new virtual environment called 'my_env'?
questions.explanation: The built-in 'venv' module is accessed using the -m flag with the python command.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of starting a new project with packages:
questions.explanation: You must build and enter the sandbox before you can start installing tools inside it.
